keyword: how many calories is in a fried egg
title: How Many Calories in a Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp oil or butter, no added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying method, added fats, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A large fried egg contains about 92 kcal and 6.3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in non-stick pan without added oil
Use 2 tsp oil instead of 1 tsp

faqs.q: How many calories is in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 92 kcal for one large fried egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 6.3 g of protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying an egg add more calories than boiling?
faqs.a: Yes, frying adds ~14-30 kcal from oil or butter compared to boiled (~78 kcal).

faqs.q: How much fat is in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 7.5 g total fat, including 2 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Yes, use a non-stick pan with no oil to drop it to about 62 kcal.
